item.title: Guilty - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Guilty - Tebere N'ebindi

"Order in the court!" The tall dark woman, dressed in the Commission's sharp uniform barked at the gathered crowd. The noise tapered off, fading to rustling clothes and chair legs scraping across the floor as people sat down.My heart had migrated to my head, every heartbeat pounding out doom, a consistent and constant drumming.

item.title: Otim's Sword - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Otim's Sword - Tebere N'ebindi

(For Arao Ameny, whose letter opener inspired this story) Darkness crept across the lush landscape, quieting tittering birds and screaming cicadas. The lull of dusk always transformed the beautiful landscape, creating leaping shadows, releasing sinister hunters from their lairs. The night was coming. Arao sat quietly beside her grandmother, watching the light from the fire.

item.title: Please, Lord - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Please, Lord - Tebere N'ebindi

This time I'm going to say it. I am going to tell her exactly what is on my mind. It is easy. I practised it in the mirror. I'm going to go for something scathing, just so she knows she hurt me. Chin up. Eyes narrowed. Lips in a thin stern line.

item.title: Sister Queen - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Sister Queen - Tebere N'ebindi

Once upon a time, a woman inherited a kingdom. To the west, grassy knolls rolled over the countryside curving artfully around overflowing gardens that burst with bounty, stretching as far as the eye could see.

item.title: Someone Else - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Someone Else - Tebere N'ebindi

Someone Else The hallway was empty.The clean floor, polished by years of moping rags and stomping feet, reflected the cool, crisp early morning light through the glass door that marked its end.

item.title: Truth Telling - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Truth Telling - Tebere N'ebindi

Truth Telling Once upon a time a young man met a young lady. In his presence, she effervesced and he was run over by his emotions into the dream of romance. In her words he found comfort and the missing companion with whom he could share his innermost being.

item.title: What's on my mind? RAGE. - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
What's on my mind? RAGE. - Tebere N'ebindi

White hot rage that melts the hardened material that swallowed my ancestors one by one.It is bubbling up, searing soft tissue, digging raw, bloody canyons as it creeps up my throat erupting in hot air in my mouth. I taste it when I breathe and spit the bile out.

item.title: Kigezi - Tebere N'ebindi
item.description:
Kigezi - Tebere N'ebindi

I'm going to ask you to create a picture in your mind. Close your eyes. It might help. Rocky grey hills stretching up towards the sky with a singular thought - touch the sky. Grassy knolls clinging to craggy, sharp ledges where the top soil had long been eroded, having been brought here by heavy, torrential rainfall that is common to this place.
